para: EdgeFromElements is a , used as the constructor argument of the command when building &skel; boundaries. It creates Edge Boundaries from the currently selected &skel; &elems; or from a group of &elems;. The &elems; are specified by the group parameter, which must be either the name of an &elem; group or the special object, selection.

The boundary is constructed from the &sgmts; that are on the perimeter of the given group of &elems;. &sgmts; that are shared by two &elems; in the group will not form part of the boundary. It is not possible to construct an edge boundary from a set of non-contiguous &elems;.

Edge boundaries must be constructed from a single contiguous non-branching set of &sgmts;, and they must be directed. Boundary conditions use the direction to determine the boundary normal and the direction of applied &fields; and &fluxes;. The direction parameter specifies the direction of the boundary being created. The legal values for direction generally depend on the topology of the boundary being constructed. The edges bounding a set of &elems; always form a closed loop, so the legal values of direction are 'Clockwise' and 'CounterClockwise'.
shows some examples of edge boundaries created from &elems;, and of sets of &elems; from which it's impossible to create boundaries.
